title: Mexican Rice
directions: Heat oil, then add rice. Stir to coat grains and saute until they start to turn brown - about 10 minutes. Add chopped onion, garlic, bell pepper, jalapeneo, cumin, salt and pepper. Stir and saute a couple of minutes. Pour in 1/2 cup of tomato sauce and two cups of water (or cup of broth and water). Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and cover. Cook rice according to directions (about 20 minutes). Turn off heat and let set another five minutes. Serve with a favorite entree.
ingredients: 1 cup of rice - usually white, but brown is okay (follow package cooking directions).
4 ounces tomato sauce - 1/2 cup, or a tablespoon of tomato paste.
2 cups of water - substitute a cup of chicken or vegetable broth for extra flavor.
1 tablespoon of garlic - fresh chopped, or from jar.
